newsitem.title: USA: Krantor negotiates phone card deal.
newsitem.headline: Krantor negotiates phone card deal.

text.p: Krantor Corp said Thursday it has negotiated an agreement with a 100-plus store supermarket chain in the Northeast to provide the chain with a comprehensive prepaid telephone calling card program.

Krantor did not disclose the name of the telecommunicatios company involved of the supermarket chain, but said that the agreement could represent in excess of $1.5 million in annual prepaid telephone card sales.
Under terms of the three-year contract, the telecommunications company becomes the exclusive prepaid calling card services provider for the supermarket chain.

Krantor is engaged in the food brokerage business, specializing in the distribution of frozen seafood and brand name grocery products to major wholesalers and retailers in the United States and the Caribbean.
It recently said that it has an exclusive marketing agreement to sell prepaid long distance telephone cards to Caribbean and select U.S. customers.
